body_html:
To be honest, I didn't tought about doing this... Shame on me ...

On the other hand, it's quite illogical to have the same functionality (ones_like and zeros_like) in two different functions to do basically the same operation that could be wrapped into one.

This will ease the code-base maintainance effort, only maintaining one function instead of two.

You tell me, if it's worth the effort cleaning my work and writing the unittest, I will submit the PR

body:
To be honest, I didn't tought about doing this... Shame on me ...

On the other hand, it's quite illogical to have the same functionality (ones_like and zeros_like) in two different functions to do basically the same operation that could be wrapped into one.

This will ease the code-base maintainance effort, only maintaining one function instead of two.

You tell me, if it's worth the effort cleaning my work and writing the unittest, I will submit the PR
